Typically, the actual contrast is between [i] and [ay], but realizations like [ey] count as [diphthong] on a par with [ay]. Realization of the consonant is irrelevant.
What is relevant is +/- voicing of the first consonant, not the vowel

What is relevant is the presence an nature of the third consonant (t vs. c vs. 0). It can be problematic to distinguish "t" vs. "c" (these values can be collapsed later). The actual realization of the first consonant etc. is irrelevant

Variable_comms: Make sure that the form elicited is the past tense form (e.g. something like "dvik-é-lan, where -lan is the 1PL subject L-suffix). Actual forms used can be different from expectations, but what is relevant is the 3PL object S-suffix (thus, "dvik-é-lan" vs. "dvik-í-lan").
